title: How to Make Coconut Liqueur

steps.headline: Heat the coconut milk, cream, desiccated coconut, sugar, and milk.
steps.description: Place the ingredients in a saucepan over medium heat. Heat the mixture until the sugar melts, stirring on occasion.

steps.headline: Place the mixture in a separate container (optional).
steps.description: You can place your mixture into an airtight container after heating it. However, you can also place your saucepan directly in the fridge if you have room.

steps.headline: Chill the mixture.
steps.description: As soon as the sugar melts, remove the coconut milk mixture from the stove. Place it in the fridge and leave it there for a few hours. The mixture should be very chilled, similar to the temperature of water stored in the fridge, before you continue with the recipe.

steps.headline: Mix in the alcohol and coconut essence.
steps.description: Once the mixture is cold, add your alcohol and coconut essence. Mix everything together using a spoon until you have a uniform mixture.

steps.headline: Strain the mixture.
steps.description: Pour the coconut mixture through a sieve. This will strain out any big chunks of coconut, which can be discarded after straining.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the mixture for a few days.
steps.description: Place your mixture in an airtight bottle or a container like a mason jar. Leave it in the fridge for a few days to let all the ingredients mix together.

steps.headline: Shake the mixture.
steps.description: After a few days have passed, give the mixture a few good shakes. This will help even out any ingredients that have separated while it was chilling in the fridge. Always shake the mixture just before serving.

steps.headline: Refrigerate before serving.
steps.description: Coconut liqueur is best served chilled. Keep it in the refrigerator before serving it and keep it in the refrigerator in between pouring drinks.

steps.headline: Add a splash to any cocktail for a mild coconut flavor.
steps.description: You can add your coconut liqueur to any cocktail you're making. It can add a slightly sweet taste to classic mixed drinks like rum and coke or gin and tonic. However, make sure to only add a shot or less to make sure the drink isn't too strong.

steps.headline: Use your liqueur in a piña colada.
steps.description: A piña colada is usually made with white rum, pineapple juice, coconut milk, fresh lime juice, and demerara syrup. Swap out the coconut milk for your coconut liqueur for an extra strong twist on the classic cocktail. Simply add all the ingredients to a cocktail strainer, shake, and then pour your drink into a glass.

steps.headline: Discard the liqueur after a few months.
steps.description: Coconut liqueur will not keep for more than two to three months. Write a date on the bottle you keep your liqueur in and discard it after a few months.
